values:
So, yeah.  I don't have a cell phone anymore.  I repeat, no cell phone.  Don't call it or text message it.  I don't have it anymore.

Life sucks without a cell phone.

I still have the physical phone though, I'll probably go reactivate it in a couple weeks when I get some dough.

I'll be 18 in 10 days.

Caleb's doing well for everyone who's shown concern.

So who do you think is gonna win the Superbowl today?  My guess is the Panthers.  I'm not a football fan, but I get into it when Superbowl nears.  I don't think it's so much of a big deal down here as it was last year, because last year the hometown won and this year they didn't do crap.  I don't like the Bucs.

Things come all at once and it's too much to take.  I am better now, but I can still hear my 15-year-old self telling me to take a razor to my arm.  No.  I won't do that anymore.  I quit that along time ago.  

Caleb's leg was amputated today.  I want to see how everything went and make sure he's doing okay, but I don't want to bother his family right now.  Although the concern is killing me inside.  It just breaks my heart to know he's in the hospital again, let alone he has cancer.  But I guess what he told me yesterday was right, you need to have a sense of humor in order to survive.  I'm just taken back by how calm he is.

Today was the last day I'll see Sarah until the end of March.  On the way home I had to pull over into a parking lot and just screamed and cried and let all my emotion out.  I needed it.

Oh, and Dad, you snoop around for skeletons in the closet.  I'm pretty sure you have quite a few skeletons hanging up there too.  My close friends know what I'm talking about.

Caleb has connective tissue cancer.  He called me today and told me that the cancer was just around his right knee, but just in that area alone they've found multiple malignant tumours, most to deep to just cut out.  So in order to prevent the cancer from spreading, his right leg is going to be amputated, and chemotherapy for precaution incase of any dormant cells.  I had to prevent myself from crying because I had to drive.  The reality of this is hitting slowly but hard.  Now I know how people feel when they say, "You never think cancer will hit close to home."

Sarah is leaving on Feb. 4th for basic training.  I'm at her house right now, and tomorrow I go home and it will be the last time I see her before her graduation from basic.  

I need somebody to hug me.

create your own visited states map or check out these Google Hacks. Travel Plans for 2004: End of March - Sarah's graduation for basic training in Missouri Spring Breakish - Trip w/ LeLe (most likely to NYC) End of April - Upstate NY for great grandpa's burial Summer - Out west (The Rocky Mountains & The Grand Canyon) ...and maybe more. There's alot of places I'd like to go this year. Forget to mention yesterday the trip to the dentist. Wasn't as bad as my old dentist, but I still don't like going. They smoothed out my chipped tooth, and told me I have Periodontal Disease, and I have a really bad infection in the gum line of my left upper back teeth. So I have to go in on February 6th (Caleb's b-day) for one of those extreme cleaning surgeries. *groans* I'm also getting my wisdom teeth pulled sometime in the near future. *groans* We've been drowning in rain last night and this morning. The wind blew the front door open just enough to make the alarm go off and wake my dreamful self up. That happend around 2, then I didn't go back to sleep and started watching TV, then around 4 lightning hit the house. I think it just hit the satellite cause the TV went out for a few minutes. Good thing the power didn't go on. I literally have panic attacks in total darkness. My cell phone just died. Darn. Gotta go charge it.

I am really depressed right now.  It's a mixture of different things, I'm sad that tomorrow and Wednesday will be the last time I see Sarah for a long time, and we will miss each other's milestone b-day.  I'm also developing nervousness about different things that are coming up, and not because I'm unsure.  It's the kind of nervousness you feel when your interviewing for your dream job.  But I blamed it on being unsure, I don't know if anyone read the last post before I edited it.  To all I did confuse though, I'm sorry.  I can't believe I said it out loud.  The reason I'd edited it was because I couldn't stand looking at it.  I'm sorry, I'm very emotional right now, and I'll be back to normal shortly.  

Today was the first time I actually cried about the possibility of not being able to naturally conceive children of my own.  

I'm sure mood swings from it being that time of the month aren't helping either.

I just need to keep the faith.

"Muh bebe" turned 13 yesterday. :-) Annie turns 3 tomorrow. :-) Can you tell I love my pets a whole lot? hehe Sarah's in the army now. She leaves for basic training on February 4th. I'm very happy for her, but I am so sad she's leaving. I have to keep reminding myself it's too soon to cry. I promise I'm gonna try to make it to your graduation, Sarah! Even if I have to lie, cheat, and steal. ----- *EDITED: The paragraph that was here has been edited. Sorry, personal issues are messing with my head. If you need answers, call me. It's complicated. ------ Okay, so I realized today, and no, I'm not trying to be cocky, that I'm a better drawer than I thought I was. Well, not a drawer. More like I doodler/cartoonist. ------ What would you all think if I got Gastric Bypass Surgery? I know, it is an extremely risky surgery. But I'm in the middle of exploring it as a last resort if I can't loose weight. And I qualify for the surgery. This isn't something I'm just gonna go out and do tomorrow though. I'm going to keep studying up on it, and if I still feel this is something I want to do, I'm going to ask my doctor about it when I see him in May. ------ I need a part-time job that pays good money. Any suggestions?

It's official.  I have a bad back.  Damnit.

And as if my 24/7 back pain wasn't bad enough, today <font color="red">Aunt Flo</font> decided to pay me her week-long monthly visit.  Costco, Sam's Club, and BJ's are my favorite stores for this situation.  Where else can you buy a box of almost 100 tampons?  Ahh, I won't have to spend my hard working money of them for the next couple of months.

I am saving the current money I have right now for when I open a bank account.  What a pleasant thought, no more money orders and having to wait impatiently for things over the internet.  It's on my list of things to do when legal day comes. (People who've already passed the 18 mark are probably going "Yeah, yeah, yeah, whatever you say...")

I want..to..do...nothing today.  But that's not possible, I still have afternoon horse duties and we're getting a delivery of stuff (hay, feed, etc.) at the barn today, so it's my job to run the tractor so when can put multiple loads of <font color="yellow">T&A</font> and <font color="green">alfalfa</font> up in the hay loft.

For the farm illiterate, T&A and alfalfa are two different types of hay.

Time to go nap in a fetal position.

Sacrifices suck.


Maybe that's why I always catch myself in contradiction.

I still hate my back.

I'm finally getting my chipped tooth fixed on Monday.  I've been cutting the inside of my mouth with it too many times.

I'm getting back control over of my domain names tomorrow.  Yay!  I'm gonna get hosting service for it as soon as I get some more ca$h and I get my own piece of plastic, because I'm not gonna spend six months waiting for confirmation like I did with the money order to register the domain name.  Maybe I'll finally be able to put up my music.  

Man, how I'd love to start playing shows this spring.  I think I will.  Got to do some research on that.  

Hanson are the only people I know who procrastinate more than I do.

To my back, I hate you.

I've rediscovered eBay.  I'm going on a bidding spree!

I'm having one of those days where I just don't want to do anything.  

What should I do for my 18th birthday, coming up in 23 days.  I am NOT going clubbing.

People, please read the following...I don't go clubbing, it is not my thing, nor will it be ever.  I do not like to drink, and I never want do it again as long as I live.  I dress like I do because I like the way I dress. I'd prefer to keep to myself.  There is a big difference between who I think is cute and who I would want to date.  I do not like rap or hip-hop music.  I hate it when people question or tease me about the following I have just mentioned.

My grandmother spent the night and forgot we have an alarm system.  She went to go out the sliding glass door before anyone woke up and the alarm started screaching at unnatural decipals.  I felt like screaming in frustration.

My back is killing me.  Not even Perkiset seems to help.  Mom thinks it's just sore muscles from strenous work at the barn, and my dad thinks it might be a kidney infection.  All I know is that if it doesn't subside by Monday I'm making a doctor's appointment.  

I donated blood yesterday.  I thought I might pass out because they played around with the needle after it was already stuck in me, apparently my right arm has a deep vein.  I looked at it.  I'm no sissy, but it is a little bit odd to watch your blood pour out into a long tube and down into a bag full of it.  I'm O POS if anyone needs a blood transfusion.  
"Have you ever had sex with a male that has had sex with another male?"
"Have you ever accepted money in exchange for sex or drugs?"
"Have you ever give in exchange for sex or drugs?"

When my back gives me a break, I'm gonna gut out my room.  I'm going to put some shelves on the walls and see if I can fit a Pappason (sp?) chair in there.  If I do say so myself, I think my bedroom looks spectacular at night.  I turn on my fan's blue neon light, my lava lamp, and my fiber-optic fairy ball.  No wonder I don't want to go to sleep.

Can't wait til the big computer is finally fixed, then I can move the ASUS into my room.  YAY!  Then I'll be able to play Sims, and go on the intenet, all day, everday.

Off to wonder.

I haven't been feeling well.  I just ache all over.  Especially my back.  

Polycystic Ovary Syndrome has ruined my life.  I could be 100lbs lighter, and my chances of having children in the future wouldn't be in jeporady.  Just listen to me gripe and moan.  People, don't get mad.  Obesity makes life a living hell.

Music, my horses, and faith.  They take me away, and make me forget about the world around me.  It makes me happy.
Nothing much is new. Just the baby. I've been spending most of my time at the barn. I posted pictures of Sandy in my horse community.

We have a new horse.  She is a 9-month-old filly.  She is a registered APHA, her sire is a Paint Horse, and her dam is a Throughbred.  She is a chestnut & white tovero coloring.  She has one blue eye and one brown eye.  Her barn name is Sandy.  

I'm feeling very guilty right now, because it's her first night tonight at our barn, it's her first time away from the place she was born and grew up and where her mother is at.  

Pictures will come shortly.

18 years ago today, my friend Christina came into this world to wreck havoc....
HAPPY BIRTHDAY YOU!!!!

The computer crashed and sparked the other day.  That is not good.  Thanks to the ASUS though, I am connected back to the world.  

My chipped tooth and the rest of my back teeth on the top left side of my mouth keep reminding me I need to go to the dentist.  Grrr.

There are other things I wish to talk about, but are not appropriate for here.  Friends, I'll talk to you later.

So, what do I know is it store this year?  Hmmm...turning 18, SATs, graduating, starting college...and all that jazz.  

I chipped a tooth today.  Dentist next week.  I dislike going to the dentist.  I dislike going to the dentist more than I dislike going to the gynocologist.  And that's probably saying something...

Is it me, or do dentists do nothing but criticize?

Next dentist that says "You need to floss more" is getting some of his own teeth punched out.

I use to have alot of dental issues as a kid.  I've had three teeth pulled out at once.  I've had partial braces.  Then I had full braces.  I've had two cavities.  I've had jaw surgery twice.  And now I have my first chipped tooth.

The pain.  The pain.

It's scary when you need to make a big decision.  It gets even scarier when a deadline approaches.  Afraid you'll make the wrong decision, and wonder if you can live with any sacrifices that are added to it.  

So, what are you going to do?  Can't say it out loud, cause then you'll change your mind ten minutes later.  I guess there are some decisions you have to make on your own,  and not reveal until the deal and sealed.  But it's hard without support.  I guess there are sacrifices in the decision making process too.  

I'll stop making posts like this, and let you know the outcome when I've made a final decision.  I'd like it if you could help, but I will only be able to see your help as an outside influence.  

Don't worry, it is not a life or death or health related situation.  I'm not breaking friendships off with anybody.  

I just need to talk with myself and search for guidance.

What is in store for this year?  I am not sure.  I know what I want to achieve and do.  But it's so confusing, because when the time arrives, you get somewhat nervous, and wonder.  Are you going to have regrets later?  Are you going to change your mind?  And what if you ask yourselves these questions if what you do is irreversable?  And when you're pulled by two different forces, and also smothered with outside influences.  Where is the dividing line between "what you know you what and you know is right" and "what you've been told you should what and what you've been told is right"?  Sometimes I just can't tell the different.  Maybe I am submissive, or a follower, whatever word you want to use.

Like I believe I said in the post before the last one, I am going to do what I know in my heart is right.  Whatever it may be.  And once I have it all figured out, no one can make me believe that I am wrong.

I spent New Years Eve at LeLe's apartment.  Good times.  

I'll upload pictures when Sarah sends me hers and LeLe gets hers developed.

I am going to like myself.  I am going to be who I want to be, do what I want to do, think what I want to think, believe what I want to believe, love what I want to love, and nobody can tell me that it's wrong.

I'm spending tomorrow up in Pine-apple-es.  <---I just made that word up.

Cross your fingers for Sarah.

2003 what did you do in 2003 that you'd never done before?: visited states i hadn't been to before, tried pot, drove over the skyway bridge, and more i can't think of did you keep your new year's resolutions, and will you make more for next year?: didn't keep last years. i have alot of resolutions for this year, but i'm gonna keep them a secret, cause maybe they'll actually work if i don't tell anyone. did anyone close to you give birth?: my ex-boyfriend's mother had a baby girl on Sept 11th. did anyone close to you die?: my great-grandfather passed away on Nov 23rd. what places did you visit?: new york. georgia. south carolina. north carolina. tennessee. kentucky. illinois. missouri. iowa. nebraska. south dakota. wyoming. colorado. california. hawaii. what would you like to have in 2004 that you lacked in 2003?: money. an active music career. a job. what date from 2003 will remain etched upon your memory?: many that were sparadic throughout the year. what was your biggest achievement of the year?: i'm not sure... what was your biggest failure?: probably alot of things. did you suffer illness or injury?: a physical assault. the flu twice. a black toe. and a horse ass-kicking. what was the best thing you bought?: my Epiphone Les Paul whose behavior merited celebration?: wow, that's a hard one... whose behavior made you appalled and depressed?: i won't say their names on the count of reputations. where did most of your money go?: eBay, Sam Ash, and miscellaneous expenses. what did you get really, really, really excited about?: road trip and hawaii what songs will always remind you of 2003?: "disease" by matchbox twenty and "harder to breathe" by maroon 5. and many more... compared to this time last year, are you: i. happier or sadder? about the same, maybe happier. ii. thinner or fatter? ha...fatter iii. richer or poorer? about the same. i'm a broke ass. what do you wish you'd done more of: worked on my music, money saving what do you wish you'd done less of?: spend money how did you spend the holidays?: at home. grandmother came over. made steaks. how will you be spending new years?: up in the hometown with friends did you fall in love in 2003?: was in love but fell out of love. :*( how many one night stands?: haha...none. what was your favorite TV program?: Who's Line Is It Anyway?, and Sex and the City do you hate anyone now that you didn't hate this time last year?: maybe lost a bit of respect... do you like anyone now that you hated this time last year?: hmmm... what was the best book you read?: the whole Harry Potter series what was your greatest musical discovery?: various independent artists. what did you want and get?: that Epiphone Les Paul I had been eye-balling at Sam Ash for the past year and a half. what did you want and not get?: a new acoustic guitar, maybe next year. what was your favorite film of this year?: wow...i saw alot of good movies this year. two the stand out are The Life of David Gale and Gothika. what did you do on your birthday?: went to Carrabba's. coughed myself a headache that almost ended up with an ER visit. what one thing would have made your year immeasurably more satisfying?: if i had started playing shows and gotten my website all done. how would you describe your personal fashion concept in 2003?: my style. which is whatever i like that i can afford and fit into. what kept you sane?: music and friends which celebrity/public figure did you fancy the most?: silverchair and matchbox twenty what political issue stirred you the most?: not sure. who did you miss?: alot of people who was the best new person you met?: i met alot of cool new LJ friends. :) tell us a valuable life lesson you learned in 2003: don't let anything or anyone stand in the way of being yourself. and as long as you believe in your dreams, they'll come true. quote a song lyric that sums up your year: "You can't control me, and you can't take away from me who I am" - Quasimodo by Lifehouse

Hope everyone had a good Christmas.  

I got a new cell phone and switched services.  So if you want my new number, get a hold of me.  Comment, e-mail, IM, whatever.

----

You're all that I want, you're all that I need, you're everything...

Apparently, our Santa Clause suffered a snowy and bloody death. That teaches me to leave my works of art by the smoking oven I was cooking pizza in. Heading for church in about an hour. Yeah, late, eh? Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays. And Happy Whatever-you-celebrate-if-you-don't-celebrate-Christmas.

I never thought it would be so hard to find one of those cool 3 foot tall fiber-optic Christmas trees.  Fork!

I've been under spells of insomnia ever since I got back from Hawaii, although apparently everyone else has adjusted back to regular time.  I haven't really be doing anything or going anywhere, except to go take care of the horses.  I've been sitting around waiting for every girl's favorite aunt to visit.

Sorry everyone, you probably won't get your Christmas presents till January.  I'm broke.  So, if you want something in a decent price range that you don't get for Christmas, let me know.

I think I'm coming down with the flu.

I saw Simon & Garfunkel last night in concert.

Ahhh, I'm home! I'm so happy!!! Even if it is below 40 degrees outside. I get enough 80 degree weather during the summer, and after three weeks I kind of got tired of staring at this everyday.
No offense, because I do think Hawaii is pretty, but it's a tad bit overrated and TV and pictures make it look alot nicer. Things look a bit dirty. And buildings looked like they were ready to keel over, even our hotel (ahem, condo) looked like it was gonna fall apart. Oh wait, it did!
Well, not the actual building itself, as you can tell. Just the carpool. It was scary when it happend, which was on the 6th. The piece they collasped fell on top of a car with kids inside, and their mother was screaming. I thought she had just lost her children right before my eyes. But suprisingly and thankfully, no one was killed or even injured. I could go on and on about Hawaii, but I won't. I've been there now, I don't need to go back anytime soon. Now that I'm home, I think I need to adjust back to my own time zone and go to bed. Sleep is not something I've seen much of since the 18th. I've put big meaning to the word insomnia. NOW THIS, was the ultimate highlight of my trip.

This will be my last post until Christmastime.  Tomorrow afternoon we go over to Tampa and stay overnight at the Marriott Hotel that's connected to the airport.  Then we take off on Dec. 1st at 8:25am.  

So I'll see you all later, and I'll take lots of pictures.

Buh-bye.

WHO WAS THE LAST PERSON WHO...
 
Slept in your bed: Myself, every single night.
Made you cry: I'm not sure.  Mostly things that are exanimate make me cry.
You shared a drink with: I took a sip of Sarah's soda earlier this month and we both got the flu...cause Kera drank for it too.
You went to the movies with: Sarah and Kera
You went to the mall with: Mom
Yelled at you: Not sure.
Sent you a comment: LeLe
Said they were going to castrate you: No one ever has, No one ever will

Have you ever??
Said "I love you" and meant it? yes
Gotten into a fight? I'm usually the one who gets beat up, I don't fight back.
Been to Hawaii? I'M GOING MONDAY BABY!!!
Get lost? in grocery stores when i was little
Been to Canada? nope
Danced naked? nope
Got a really bad feeling about something then it happened? yeah

Red or Blue? blue
Spring or Fall? fall
Santa or Rudolph? rudolph, i always wanted my own reindeer...
Math or English? math

RANDOM QUESTIONS...

What are you going to do after you finish this survey? put lunch in the oven
What was the last food you ate? a bowl of cereal
High school or college? i can't wait for college!
Are you bored? often
How many buddies are on? none at the present time
Last movie you saw? "Gothika"
Last noise you heard? current noises...the television
Last time you went out of the state: July...Smyrna, TN
Things you like in a guy/girl: got about an hour?
Do you have a crush on someone? not really
Do they know? i keep my crushes to myself
What's his/her name? hey! what'd i just say?
What do you think of ouija boards? they're fun when your bored
What book are you reading now? you'd laugh if i tell you...
What's on your mouse pad? a plain black one...but it's got the cushy thing that prevents carpal tunnel.
Favorite board game? Life
Favorite magazine? don't have a favorite
Worst feeling in the world? losing all hope
What is the first thing you think when you wake in the morning? i want to go back to sleep...
How many rings before you answer? two
Future daughter's name: Michelle or Jacqueline
Future son's name? Zachary or Jonah
Chocolate or vanilla? Godiva baby!
Do you sleep with a stuffed animal? lots of pillows
If you could have any job you wanted, what would it be? i have so many things i want to be...
Are you a lefty, righty or ambidextrous? lefty
Do you type with your fingers on the right keys? yes
What's under your bed? i'm afraid to look
Favorite sport to watch? soccer
Hair Color: brown w/ blonde highlights
Eye Color: blue
Height Currently: 5'6"
Glasses/contacts: glasses for driving...otherwise nothing
Current Age: 17
Siblings: none
Siblings age: see above answer
located in: Bradenton, FL
Any Piercings: five earlobes...but i think i'm gonna let them close up
Best Friends? i love you all!!!!
Boyfriend/Girlfriend: single
Are You Timely Or Always Late: depends
Do You Have A Job: not right now...i'm gonna get one when i get back from Hawaii
Do You Like Being Around People: depends

STUFF
Have you ever loved someone you had no chance with: yes
Have You Ever Cried Over Something Someone of The Opposite Sex Did: yes
Are You Lonely Right Now: no
Are You Ever Afraid You'll Never Get Married: yes.  getting married is one of my main goals in life.
Do You Want To Get Married: it's a main goal, like i said.
Do You Want Kids: if it was left up to me, i'd have no less than a dozen.

FAVORITE

Room In house: mine, the music room, and the back room
Type of music: alternative pop/rock
Song: "Push" - Matchbox Twenty
Day Of The Week: Sunday
Color: teal and pink
Perfume Or Cologne: Bath & Body Works Raspberry Spray
Flower: roses
Month: December and February
Season: fall and winter
where for dates: amusement parks

IN THE LAST 48 HOURS, HAVE YOU:

Cried: no
Bought Something: yes
Gotten Sick: no
Sang: 24/7
Said I Love You: yes 
Wanted To Tell Someone You Loved them, But Didn't: yes
Met Someone New: no
Moved On: guess so
Talked To Someone on the phone: yes
Had A Serious Talk: no
Missed Someone: yes
Hugged Someone: yes
Kissed Someone: not in a romantic sense
Fought With Your Parents: no
Had a lot of sleep: you can never get enough
Wanted This Survey To Be Over: needs more interesting questions

I slept in and they started the turkey without me.

Happy Thanksgiving.  Have fun gaining 5 pounds today.

I just now realized how much stuff we have to get done in so little time before Hawaii.  Oh boy.

And things are getting a little more hectic, my great-grandfather passed away the day before yesterday.  He was 102.  My mother is going by herself up to upstate NY for his funeral.  She leaves tomorrow and comes back the afternoon of Thanksgiving.

Sarah and I will be cooking Thanksgiving dinner.  Watch out Butterball.
Fasting is not fun when you have a sore throat and your thirsty.  I have labs in the morning. :*(
Mom let me drive to St. Pete today, without her.  It was a emotional day for her.  Sarah and I will be here for a few days.  Then back to B-Town.

Amateur movie! You might not be too experienced in
the way of sex...but chances are, you do enjoy
it (or the thought of it). We'll probably see
you in some home video that surfaces on the
internet one day.

What kind of porno would you star in?

Innocent

What's your sexual appeal?
brought to you by Quizilla
Your soul is bound to the Solitary Rose: The
Alone. "When I wake up alone, the shades are still
drawn on the cold window pane so they cast
their lines on my bed and lines on my
face." The Solitary Rose is associated with loneliness,
melancholy, and patience. It is governed by
the goddess Merope and its sign is The Sword,
or Unrequited Love. As a Solitary Rose, you may be summed up as a
hopeless romantic. You desire love and have so
much love to give, but thing just never seem to
work out the way you want them to. In life,
you can be very optomistic, even when things
are gray and nothing works out to your
expectations.

What Rose Is Your Soul Bound To?

Yesterday was really miserable.  I had a pelvic ultrasound, so I had to drink at least 32oz. of fluid an hour before I went in.  So by the time I went in, not only was I sick with the flu, but I had to pee so bad I was on the verge of crying and bursting.

I have another doctor's appointment today.  Blah.  Time to go.

Oh, there's a Tornado Watch in my area.  It just looks so glamorous outside.

Sarah and I have one very screwed up flu.  Headache, earache, sinusache, snuffy/runny nose, sore throat, that lovely substance that comes out of your throat, and possibly a fever.  I just want to take some medicine and go take a nap.

We went to Busch Gardens today.  

- Some idiot who rode Qwazi was stupid enough to loose thier keys on the ride.  So it was closed for awhile.  How you find things you've lost on a rollercoaster, I'm not sure.  
- Sarah made me go on The Phoenix twice.  Not too bad.  I've felt worse.
- Went on Montu.  I got a little depressed when I had to get seperated from Sarah to sit in a "special seat" because I'm an elephant, and I sat next to a lady with the most obnoxious scream that lasted the whole ride.
- My dad was a prick, as usual.  
- That Haunted Lighthouse 3-D thingy is stupid.  I didn't really watch it.  I had a nose bleed.
- We bought MONKEYS!!!

I'm gonna try to loose 20 pounds in 2 weeks, as crazy as it sounds.  It will be brutally painful, but well worth it.  Sarah's making me, LoL.  I'm doing it for myself also.  

Kera, I stole your pookie! *inside joke*

*skips merrily along*

15 Days To Hawaii

My mom and I were driving in the Navigator, she was driving and I was in the passenger's front seat.  It was pitch black nighttime, and we were heading for the barn.  I was wearing four layers of sweaters, in Florida.  I had the inner most layer pulled up over my face.  We are driving on the property now, and all of a sudden, my mother starts screaming, and I can feel the car going over bumps and speeding all over the place.  I took the sweater from off my face and it's still pitch black, except for the glowing figure my mother seems to be driving around.  It is a creepy looking serial killer wearing a wide brim hat and holding a knife, and his face was deformed.  He kept walking toward the car as my mom was driving in circles around the property, and I start screaming "YOU HAVE A CAR!  RUN OVER HIM!!!!  DO YOU HEAR ME?  RUN HIM OVER!!!!"  
Mom puts the pedal to the medal and speeds towards him, he holds out his arms and opens his mouth.  

A hear a loud thud and then I woke up.

What shall I watch tonight?  "Saving Jessica Lynch" or "The Elizabeth Smart Story"?  They both come on at the same time tonight, and I'd like to watch them both.  I love TV movies that are based on true stories, and these are two big ones.  I don't trust ennie-meanie-miney-moe.  

I'd like to get a whole bunch of people together, and play those games that they play on "Who's Line Is It Anyway?"  Anyone up for it?

My mom is bringing me home Macaroni & Cheese from Outback Steakhouse.  Yum.  I really should stop eating all this food that's bad for me.  

Back to where I started at, maybe I should go flip a coin...

*plops into chair because feet are aching*

Been on my feet, making the house clean.  And, of course, my Mom's definition of clean is what the rest of us call  the definition for "sterile".  I'm in need of a foot massage.

Mom has friends from New York coming down today, my parents actually just left for the airport.  It's actually pretty interesting because JetBlue has a flight tracking system, so you can see where the plane currently is.  I am too easily amused.  I've been refreshing it ever since my Dad discovered it a half hour ago.

Work makes you hungry.  So you know what that means.

Last night I decided to take out my clarinet, which I have abandoned for so long. I feel so guilty for not playing it for over a year, it's such a beautiful instrument, and I love it so much. Unfortunately, all my reeds are shot so I couldn't play it, so I must go buy more tomorrow. I still remember everything from it, even the big symphony songs I use to play when I was in the marching band. When I go to MCC or SPC next year, I'm going to join a Woodwinds Ensemble, or if they don't have one, the actual band. I'd like to go into an ensemble just for woodwinds, because I would play both my clarinet and my alto saxophone. I miss band.
Yes, that is "Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets" in the background. And we cannot forget my pretty blue alto saxophone.

I need some self discipline.  I tried fasting today (just for today...I'm not trying to starve myself to thiness).  At around 2:30pm-ish I couldn't do it anymore.  Either I really need some serious self discipline or that I probably shouldn't drive when I fast (it's not exactly a great feeling to know I could make myself crash somewhere in the 2.5 miles between the barn and the house).  *sighs*

I have too many clothes (I'm a clothes hoarder!).  I should clean out my dresser and my closet and pick out stuff to take to Goodwill and stuff to throw away.  My closet is just begging for breathing room.

What else is new...oh yeah...uhhh, errr...I went to a certain type of doctor just the other day.  And, um, well, yeah.  It was a fun filled day, from the beginning when my mother had a fight over the phone with my primary doctor's referral-giving lady all the way to when my mom backed the truck up into a tree in the parking lot.  (It was a poorly placed tree, I swear!)
Anyways, I have Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome.  Got to go do more labs, get a stomach ultrasound, and then we discuss "further treatment options" (that phrase makes it sound like we'll be discussing how to treat cancer...)   

I'm sure I've discussed some interesting topics today.  I'm just looking forward to all of your wonderful comments.  :)

What the heck happend to Star 95.7??????????????????  It's changed from an alternative rock station to a hip-hop station.  I hate hip-hop!!!  Where did my station go?

Happy Halloween.

Christina and I went and saw "Mystic River" today. It wasn't what I really expected, considering that it was rated R. It would make a good episode of "Law & Order". There are a couple of disturbing scenes. It's a "wait untill it comes on HBO" movie. After the movie, we went and bought some pumpkins. We didn't carve them yet.
The view from the front porch is pretty right now, but picture's don't do much for it.
And here are some photos from Monday night, curtesy of Sarah (thanks man!).
See ya later.

I saw Hanson on Monday night at House of Blues over in Orlando, they still continue to amaze me, and continue to make great music. If only people would give them the time of day. They're are just so wonderful. We went in early because of my mom, so Sarah and I went and got up front, and stayed there the whole show (yay! hehe). Mom and Christina stayed out of the crowd. Sarah had her phone with her, so we did manage to get some pictures (even though cameras aren't allowed). They did an encore of Christina Aguilera's "Dirrty". It was quite amusing. They only not-so-great part, I have so much disrespect for fans of them. They were revealing clothing, the have so much hatred towards the people up front that they feel the need to kill you to death just so you can touch thier hands, they scream at inappropriate moments, and they throw stuff on stage. During "Penny and Me", someone thought it would be a good idea to throw pennies on stage. One not only hit the back of my head, but the ones that made it on stage hit Isaac's Taylor 810 guitar and scratched it. People, grow up. Now that I've vented, and I'll go back and say how awesome the concert was. It was awesome.

It's started off when my mother and I decided to go out to breakfast at Cracker Barrel. Afterwards, we went to go walk around the store part and check out the Halloween stuff. As I was walking towards it, I slipped on something but caught my balance. "Have a nice trip?", asked my mom. "Err...yeah. What did I step in?" I asked. We looked down and saw something smeared on the floor. "I don't know, it looks like some kind of gel. I'll go get someone to clean it up. Wait here," mom said. A few moments after she left, a foul smell came into the air. It was a familiar smell, but nothing I came across everyday. Then my eyes widened as I realized I just stepped in HUMAN VOMMIT. Mom came back with someone and got a whiff of the smell and came to the same conclusion as I did. Then the person she brought back with her noticed another pile of it (unsmeared) about 6 feet away. Then the manager came over, as someone came out of the men's bathroom and reported that someone had thrown up all over the place. You know, leave it to a man to throw up and not tell anyone about it. Gosh, that was so disgusting! And it was on the bottom of my shoe!!! After wiping my shoe off in the grass, we headed over to the barn to feed the horses. When we got to the gate, it was unlocked! Nothing was stolen, so we figured Dad came and got the fishing poles off of the boat, cause he's competing in a fishing tournament tomorrow. But then we called my Dad and he said he hadn't been there. So someone came onto our property, but didn't steal anything after realizing that everything we kept there was locked up nice and tight. Man, too many low life theieves live in Myakka City. It was a nice morning this morning, it was that cool temperture where I love to walk on the driveway barefoot. Ahhh.... Dad's on his way home, and he's bringing home Subway. Yum!
